content.question: The position of a particle moving in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is given by the parametric functions <math alttext="x of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="the derivative of x, with respect to t, equals, t times the sine of, open parenthesis, pi times t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to t, equals, the fraction with numerator 30, and denominator, open parenthesis, 3 t, plus 1, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The position of the particle is <math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 comma 7, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the particle’s position vector <math alttext="open angled bracket, x of t, comma y of t, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open angled bracket, the sine of, open parenthesis, pi times t squared, close parenthesis, plus 2 pi, times t squared, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, pi times t squared, close parenthesis, comma, the negative of the fraction with numerator 180, and denominator, open parenthesis, 3 t, plus 1, close parenthesis, cubed, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>180</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, negative 2 pi, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, pi times t squared, close parenthesis, plus 2 minus 2 pi, comma, the negative of the fraction with numerator 10, and denominator 3 t, plus 1, end fraction, plus 8, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, the negative of the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, pi times t squared, close parenthesis, plus 2 minus the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, comma, the negative of the fraction with numerator 10, and denominator 3 t, plus 1, end fraction, plus 8, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, the negative of the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, pi times t squared, close parenthesis, plus 2 minus the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, comma, the negative of the fraction with numerator 30, and denominator 3 t, plus 1, end fraction, plus 10, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open angled bracket, the negative of the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, pi times t squared, close parenthesis, plus 2 minus the fraction 1 over 2 pi, end fraction, comma, the negative of the fraction with numerator 10, and denominator 3 t, plus 1, end fraction, plus 8, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
